perturbation.original_text:
2.3 "PRODUCT(S)" means McDATA hardware, Software, and related features, conversions, and options, as listed in the Addendum and further provided through Channel Notification Documents.

2.4 "SOFTWARE" means the computer software, In machine executable object code format only, that is delivered and licensed by McDATA with the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.3 "PRODUCT(S)" means McDATA hardware, and related features, conversions, and options, as listed in the Addendum and further provided through Channel Notification Documents.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definition of 'SOFTWARE' from the PRODUCT(S) and by removing 2.4, the contract now refers to software licenses in Section 7 and Section 5 of Premier Addendum without explicitly defining what 'SOFTWARE' constitutes. This creates ambiguity as it becomes unclear what specific software falls under the agreement, impacting the enforceability of clauses related to software licenses and intellectual property.

perturbation.original_text:
9.    TRADEMARKS.

Subject to McDATA's prior written approval, McDATA grants Reseller a limited, nonexclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use McDATA's Trademarks (defined as McDATA's name or any abbreviation thereof, its acronym, logotype or any other trademarks or trade names of McDATA) for the sole purpose of marketing and selling Products and End User Customer Services in the Territory during the term of this Agreement Reseller agrees to comply with McDATA's Logo Usage Guide, which is found at McDATA's web site, www.mcdata.com. By using McDATA's Trademarks, Reseller does not acquire any proprietary rights to such Trademarks, and Reseller agrees not to obtain or attempt to obtain, by any method, any rights, title or interest in or to any of the Trademarks. Additional provisions relating to the proper usage of the Trademarks are sat forth in Channel Notification Documents.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.    TRADEMARKS.

Subject to McDATA's prior written approval, McDATA grants Reseller a limited, nonexclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use McDATA's Trademarks for the sole purpose of marketing and selling Products and End User Customer Services in the Territory during the term of this Agreement Reseller agrees to comply with guidelines for proper usage of Trademarks set forth in Channel Notification Documents. By using McDATA's Trademarks, Reseller does not acquire any proprietary rights to such Trademarks, and Reseller agrees not to obtain or attempt to obtain, by any method, any rights, title or interest in or to any of the Trademarks.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit definition of 'Trademarks' and the reference to the 'Logo Usage Guide' on McDATA's website, the contract becomes vague regarding what constitutes McDATA's trademarks. This creates a contradiction because while the reseller is granted a license to use trademarks, the absence of a clear definition makes it difficult to determine the scope and limitations of that license. Enforcement becomes uncertain as disputes may arise over what exactly the reseller is authorized to use. If the CHANNEL NOTIFICATION DOCUMENTS are not clear, this creates a issue.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3 EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS. Reseller agrees to participate in McDATA-speciflad educational courses for purposes of training Reseller's personnel. Educational course requirements will be provided in a Channel Notification Document and must be satisfied by Reseller to maintain its status as a McDATA authorized Reseller McDATA will provide to Reseller without tuition fee, at a McDATA designated training site, the required educational courses identified on the Addendum.

5.4 END USER CUSTOMER TERMS AND CONDITIONS. Reseller will ensure that the terms of its executed agreements with End User Customers am not in conflict with this Agreement
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 END USER CUSTOMER TERMS AND CONDITIONS. Reseller will ensure that the terms of its executed agreements with End User Customers am not in conflict with this Agreement
perturbation.explanation: By removing 5.3, Educational Requirements, The 'INITIAL EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS' section of APPENDIX I is no longer supported or connected in any form. This section requires the reseller to complete both Sales and Technical Foundation training. By removing section 5.3, there is nothing backing educational requirements, as they can't 'maintain its status as a McDATA authorized Reseller' without knowing if a requirement is there.
